channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Harvard professors sue Trump over threat to $9 billion in funds
item.description: The administration’s review of Harvard includes $8.7 billion in grants and $225.6 million in contracts.

item.title: Trump’s ‘punitive’ China tariffs could end trade between the world’s two largest economies—and that would be painful, volatile, and dangerous
item.description: Can U.S.-China trade survive in a post-145% tariff world?

item.title: Germany’s Merz says Trump tariffs risk fanning a financial crisis
item.description: “President Trump’s policies are increasing the risk that the next financial crisis will hit sooner than expected,” Merz told Handelsblatt.

item.title: US won’t say whether it’s facilitating return of mistakenly deported man, despite judge’s order
item.description: The Trump administration confirmed to a federal judge Saturday that a Maryland man who was mistakenly deported remains confined in El Salvador.

item.title: Trump can pull stocks back from the brink, but bond and currency markets may not be so easily impressed as they rapidly de-dollarize
item.description: "The fact that the dollar is going down at the same time, I think, lends some more credibility to the story of investor preferences shifting."

item.title: What could a Trump recession look like? The economic outlook is bad — or worse.
Apple, Nvidia score major wins with tariff exemptions on iPhones and other tech
Gold is at a fresh record high. Does it still make sense to buy?
This common investing habit could be keeping you from some profitable stocks
8 ways to quickly save thousands in cash for a 12-month emergency fund
